properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet snow expected at the summit overnight and Sunday morning. A cold upper trough will reside over the southern interior tonight and Sunday. Steady rain is forecast to transition to wet snow at the summit of the Okanagan Connector overnight and then change back to showers by Sunday afternoon. Snowfall amounts of 2 to 5 cm are possible. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-14T20:11:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-14T04:12:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1919790006.2020
Area: Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms have developed across Alberta. A few of these thunderstorms have become severe and more are expected to become severe throughout the overnight hours. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-14T14:24:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-14T04:20:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1925170526.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:56 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located near Rocky Mountain house and is moving north at 15km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-14T05:55:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-14T02:57:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2908374779.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:37 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, toonie to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. This line of thunderstorms is located from 25 km northwest of Brooks to 15 km southwest of Medicine Hat. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
